Reviews.Title: Awesome phone.
Reviews.Author: MM
Reviews.Content: maybe this is not the best looking phone but it last forever. I have mine for over 2 years, and it survived so many drops on the concrete-no problems at all.Battery last for days, I usually charge this Nokia once a week. I don't use internet though, just phone calls, some messaging, occasionally camera.Speakerphone is loud with good quality, and camera just average.One of the best options (I know several phones don't have)-I turn off my phone for the night, but alarm still wakes me up, and Nokia asks for snooze or for switching to phone on mode. Awesome-it saves battery and no text or phone calls can wake me up).I recently upgraded my phone to LG CF360 (2 days of battery life, phone must be on all the time for alarm), buy after a couple of days I came back to old Nokia 6085.

Reviews.Title: My favorite cell phone to date
Reviews.Author: S. Adams "S. Adams"
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely wonderful cell phone. I have had mine for over 2 years. I don't use most of its many features. I tried the camera out once a long time ago and it was OK. But for just regular calling and sheer sound quality it is the best! I have never had to power off and 'reboot' this phone. The battery life is truly great! Also, the speakerphone setting delivers very clear sound both ways. This phone looks and feels solid and delivers on those promises. Compared to the Samsung and the Motorola I had before, this phone is the best by far!

Reviews.Title: Great Basic Camera Phone That Plays MP3s AND Is Durable!
Reviews.Author: Truvoice1
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone online because I love the ONE feature that all Nokia phones have that I can't seem to find on any other phone - the ability to have timed profiles so that when I go to church or a meeting or maybe I just want to take a nap; I can set the phone to silent or meeting and I know that when it is finished, the phone will return to its normal profile with all the correct ringtones, etc. Other features I like:- Easy to use as a MP3 player; MP3s can be used as ringtones, also so you don't have to pay to download ringtones- Great speakerphone- Great battery life. I can go at least 2 or 3 days without charging and that includes some Bluetooth use in the car.- Easy to use PC Suite from Nokia that enables you to manage and back up all of your pictures, contacts and music.- Great FM radio reception- Easy to use camera and video functionality- Easy to use voice recorder.- Great Bluetooth functionality. I use three different Bluetooth devices and it recognizes them and connects to them very quickly!- Contacts can be broken down and separated into groups and assigned different ringtones, etc. This is handy in that when a call comes in that is not in my contacts, I have it defaulting to the standard Nokia ringtone. This lets me know it is someone I don't know and I usually let it go to voice mail.- Lots of easy to use soft (user programmable) buttons make most of the common tasks a 1 button function. My phone is set up so that creating a text message, setting the alarm, going to camera, and going to phone book are all just one touch. Also, the shortcut menu is programmable, so the rest of the functions I use are only TWO touches!Now the stuff that's not so good:- 2GB limit on memory card- No USB port so you have to go on Amazon and/or eBay and find the correct adapter to plug into the Nokia interface. I bought one that goes to USB so I can transfer data to PC; one that goes from charging port to PC (USB) so I can charge the phone from PC; there are lots of other ones out there depending on what you want to do.- No mini jack for headphones. I bought the Nokia headphones online and they are kind of cumbersome to use but they have GREAT sound and great Bass response. I recently purchased an adapter to convert the Nokia interface to a mini jack but I haven't had a chance to use it yet.- It you a text messaging superstar, this phone is not for you. No Qwerty keyboard. I text maybe once or twice a day and it fine for that. I hate the predictive text function and have turned it off- No flash on the camera and it is not all that sharp.- FM radio only available when headphones or Bluetooth is active.In conclusion, the Nokia 6085 is a great basic phone for voice calls, occasional text messaging and playing MP3s or listening to the radio. It is nearly indestructible and has good battery life. It is user friendly and highly customizable once you get to know it. Manuals and the Nokia Suite are FREE online and are a valuable addition. REMEMBER - this phone was introduced around 2005?, so if you are looking for all of the newest bells and whistles spend your money elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: Great Long Lasting Phone!
Reviews.Author: wolfkid
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for almost 4 years now. I used it for a year and a half and lost it outside for 8 months. It went through 3 hurricanes and 19 tornadoes countless thunderstorms my uncle found it gave it to me and i plugged in the charger it came right on! It is an amazing phone. However the lcd on the back broke when my cousin slammed the phone shut so be careful of that other than that an amazing phone i would by 3 of these and probably never buy another phone again they are that reliable.Edit- Now that I have gotten used to smart phones I would say these are more for backup phones if you can afford a smart phone you probably arent looking at this one however they do make great back up phones incase your phone breaks and you need another one these will stand the test of time.

Reviews.Title: Just one flaw...
Reviews.Author: BQuimby
Reviews.Content: I have had exceptionally good experiences with Nokia products.  As I am not prone to update electronics every time something new and shiny appears, I keep using a product for years.  This phone works fine BUT the back battery plate slides off at the slightest touch.  Annoying.

Reviews.Title: Old technology but great long life phone
Reviews.Author: StasZ
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for 4 1/2 years. Been dropped thousands of times, pcs broken off, glued back on and it still works, however the main screen comes up blank. It still works great for what it was designed for....phone calls! I am looking for the same phone because in my opinion, the newer phones are not as durable.I don't want a smart phone, all I need is a phone that makes and receives calls and messages. Thank you Nokia for a great product!

NOT EVEN AN ADDRESS.This leads me to believe it may be a "reconditioned" phone even though it was represented as "new".

Reviews.Author: Paradise Reviewer "Aloha Peeps !"
